messages.subject: explaining unschooling (was transcripts )
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/14/04 8:18:14 AM, rubyprincesstsg@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/14/04 8:18:14 AM, rubyprincesstsg@... writes:

<< Or you could spend some time talking to how ever many people it takes to
explain "unschooling" a term they may not have heard of before. . . >>

I do that all the time.
If I can't do it one more time to help an always-unschooled child into
college, maybe I should've just sent him to school.

But you don't need to explain a term. You need to describe how the children
learned.

There have been links to info on books on creating transcripts listed here
already, and there are samples of how to describe unschooling QUITE honestly
here:

http://sandradodd.com/curriculum

Sandra
